Based on the user's preference cues and genre information, I would recommend "The Sea Inside" (2004). This movie deals with a terminally ill woman who must deal with her ex-husband's new lover, who will be their children's stepmother.
The movie stars Belén Rueda as the terminally ill woman and David Zayas as the ex-husband's new lover. The movie is directed by Roland Sampedro, who was himself a terminally ill man who fought for 28 years to pass laws allowing euthanasia in cases where patients are suffering unbearable pain that cannot be relieved and there is no hope of improvement.

One recommendation I have for you is the movie "The Andromeda Strain". This classic science fiction film was released in 1971 and stars such famous actors as Eric Cantona, John Gielgud, and Fanny Ardant.

The plot of "The Andromeda Strain" follows a team of scientists who are sent to a small town called New Albrecht. When the team arrives, they find that most of the residents have been killed by an unknown contagion. The team is tasked with finding out what caused the death of the residents and how to stop the contagion from spreading further.
One interesting aspect of "The Andromeda Strain" is its exploration of themes such as cloning, genetic engineering, artificial intelligence, and the potential consequences of these technologies being used for unethical purposes.
